conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph to determine positions and check if the pedestrian can catch up with the bus.

The image shows a velocity-time graph for a pedestrian and a bus. The pedestrian starts at 0 m/s and moves at a constant velocity of 8 m/s. The bus is at rest until time t = 4 seconds, after which it accelerates uniformly.
The pedestrian moves at a constant speed of 8 m/s, covering 36 meters in 4.5 seconds.
Calculate the time it takes for the pedestrian to cover 36 meters: t = 36/8 = 4.5 seconds.
At time t = 4 seconds, the bus starts moving with uniform acceleration, with an initial velocity of 0 m/s.
Calculate the time it takes for the bus to reach the pedestrian: t = 36/8 = 4.5 seconds.
Since both the pedestrian and the bus reach the point in the same time (4.5 seconds), the pedestrian catches up with the bus.
